Process.title: The Process
Process.subtitle: Every project follows a clear and proven path. From discovery to growth, we ensure precision at every step‚Äîso your digital solution is built to last and evolve.

step1.title: Immersion & Strategy
step1.desc: The journey begins by aligning our visions. We dive deep into your business objectives, market landscape, and user needs to build a solid product strategy. This foundational step ensures every design and engineering decision is aimed at your success.

step2.title: Blueprint & Validation
step2.desc: This is where strategy becomes a tangible experience. We design a high-fidelity, interactive prototype that lets you see and feel your product. By validating this 'blueprint' with real users, we eliminate risks and perfect the experience before a single line of code is written.

step3.title: Construction & Delivery
step3.desc: With a validated blueprint, our engineering team brings the vision to life with precision. Using agile methodologies, we build a robust, scalable, and pixel-perfect digital product. Through transparent sprints and continuous quality assurance, we deliver a world-class product.

step4.title: Launch & Evolutiont
step4.desc: Our work doesn't end at launch‚Äîit accelerates. We ensure a seamless deployment and then transition to monitoring real-world performance and user data. This phase establishes a cycle of continuous improvement, turning your product into an asset that evolves and grows long-term.

items1.title: You position yourselves as a 'Strategic Partner', not just a studio. What's the difference?'?
items1.desc: The difference is our investment in your business outcome. A typical studio executes a list of tasks. As your Strategic Partner, we start with the 'why'‚Äîyour business goals, your market position, and your user's needs. We contribute ideas, challenge assumptions, and ensure every design and technology decision is aimed at creating a market-defining product. Our success isn't just delivering a project; it's delivering a tangible business asset that drives your growth.

items1.title: What kind of client or project is the best fit for Rekhia?
items1.desc: We partner best with ambitious founders and established companies who view technology as a core business driver. Our ideal projects are complex digital products, B2B SaaS platforms, and applications where a deep understanding of user experience and robust engineering is critical. We thrive when we can act as a long-term strategic partner, not just a short-term vendor.

items1.title: Why should we choose Rekhia over a larger agency or hiring freelancers?
items1.desc: We offer the best of both worlds. Unlike large agencies, you get direct access to senior-level architects and avoid layers of bureaucracy. Unlike freelancers, we provide a fully integrated and accountable team covering strategy, design, and engineering under one roof. This unified process eliminates the risks and communication gaps that come with managing a fragmented team.

items1.title: Who will be working on our project?
items1.desc: Your project will be led and executed by our core team of senior architects and engineers. We do not outsource our primary work or delegate critical thinking to junior staff. You will be collaborating directly with the experts who have the experience to guide your product from strategy to launch and beyond, ensuring the highest quality and consistency.

items1.title: How do you measure the success of a project?
items1.desc: Success is measured against the business goals we define together in Phase 1. While we track project milestones like delivery dates and budget, our ultimate measures of success are your business outcomes‚Äîsuch as user adoption, conversion rates, customer satisfaction, or operational efficiency. We build products designed to move your metrics.

items1.title: Your 'Rekhia Blueprint' process is very detailed. Why is Phase 1 (Immersion & Strategy) so important?
items1.desc: The Strategy phase is the single most important factor in a project's success. By investing time upfront to validate assumptions, research the market, and align on goals, we prevent costly mistakes down the line. This phase ensures that the product we build isn't just beautifully designed and well-coded, but that it's also poised for market adoption and business growth.

items1.title: Who owns the intellectual property (IP) of the final product?
items1.desc: You do. Upon final payment, 100% of the intellectual property, including the source code and design assets, is transferred to you. We retain no ownership of the final work product. Our goal is to build your asset, not ours.

items2.title: How do you ensure transparency and alignment throughout the project?
items2.desc: Transparency is at the core of our partnership. We operate in agile sprints with regular live demos where you can see tangible progress. You'll have access to a shared Notion dashboard for tracking tasks and milestones, and a dedicated Discord channel for real-time communication. We treat you as a key member of the project team.

items2.title: What do you need from us during the project?
items2.desc: We view our clients as partners, and your active participation is key to success. We'll need your timely feedback during review sessions, your expertise on your industry and customers, and a dedicated point of contact from your team to ensure decisions can be made efficiently. The more collaborative our partnership, the better the outcome.

items2.title: What does a typical project investment look like?
items2.desc: Our partnerships are significant investments in core business assets. While every project is unique, our foundational 'Blueprint' projects typically start in the five-figure range (USD). The final investment depends on the project's complexity, scope, and strategic goals, and is always presented with a clear breakdown of value.

items2.title: How are payments handled for a project?
items2.desc: For project-based work, we typically follow a milestone-based payment structure (e.g., 40% upfront, 30% at a key milestone, and 30% upon completion). All payments are processed securely through Stripe, allowing you to pay with all major credit cards or via bank transfer. We prioritize security and convenience in all transactions.

items2.title: What happens if our project scope or priorities change mid-project?
items2.desc: Change is a natural part of product development. Our agile process is designed to accommodate it. If a new priority emerges, we discuss its impact on the timeline and budget with you transparently. We then adjust our sprint planning together to ensure we are always working on what provides the most value to your business.

items2.title: What is your technology philosophy?
items2.desc: Our philosophy is to use modern, proven, and scalable technologies that ensure your product is fast, reliable, and maintainable for years to come. We specialize in the Next.js and React ecosystem, leveraging platforms like Vercel for world-class performance. We choose tools because they are the right fit for your long-term business objectives.

items2.title: What happens after the product is launched?
items2.desc: The launch is just the beginning. Our 'Phase 4: Launch & Evolution' is designed to ensure your product thrives. For clients who want a continuous partnership, we offer dedicated 'Growth & Evolution' retainers to keep improving and scaling the product as your business grows, turning it from a project into a permanent asset.

articles.title: Privacy Policy
articles.subtitle: Effective Date
articles.introduction: Rekhia ('we,' 'our,' 'us') is a brand and service line operated by Busdigital LLC, a Limited Liability Company registered in New Mexico, USA (1209 Mountain Road Pl NE Ste N, Albuquerque, NM 87110). This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, share, secure, and retain personal data in connection with: (a) our public website (the 'Site'); (b) sales and customer-support communications; and (c) delivery of our professional services (the 'Services'). For the data collected under this policy, we act as the 'data controller'. A separate section below explains our role as a 'data processor' when we handle data on behalf of our clients. If you do not agree with this Policy, please do not use the Site or provide personal data.

docContent.title: 1. Information We Collect
content: We collect only the information needed to operate the Site, respond to inquiries, and provide Services.
list: You provide: contact details and messages you submit (e.g., name, email, company, project information), and business/billing identifiers needed for quotes or invoices.

Collected automatically: limited device/usage data (IP address, browser, pages viewed, timestamps) and cookies. Cookies are small text files that enable core functionality and, if you consent, basic analytics. You can manage cookies through your browser's settings.

From third parties: payment status/metadata from Stripe (e.g., amount, transaction ID; not full card data), delivery metadata from email or chat providers, and publicly available business information to verify leads and prevent fraud.
We do not knowingly collect data from children (see Section 8).

docContent.title: 2. How We Use Personal Data
list: Respond to inquiries and schedule conversations.
Plan, scope, and deliver the Services you request.
Issue quotes, invoices, and reconcile payments.
Operate, secure, and improve the Site.
Comply with legal, tax, and contractual obligations.
content: Where required by law (e.g., EEA/UK), our processing is based on one or more of: contract (including pre-contract steps), legitimate interests (e.g., responding to your request, site security), consent (for non-essential cookies/analytics), and legal obligation (records retention, tax).

docContent.title: 3. Sharing of Information
content: We do not sell or rent personal data. We share it only with:
list: Service providers acting on our behalf and under contract (e.g., hosting and infrastructure, email and communication tools, analytics if enabled).

All payment transactions are processed through Stripe. Stripe acts as our payment processor and may collect data necessary to complete the transaction. Please review Stripe‚Äôs Privacy Policy for details.
Professional advisers and authorities when required by law or to protect our rights (e.g., accountants, auditors, legal counsel).
Business transfers in the event of merger, acquisition, or corporate reorganization subject to appropriate safeguards.

docContent.title: 4. Data Controller and Data Processor Roles
content: We act as the 'data controller' for the information we collect from you to manage our business relationship (e.g., your contact and billing details).

We may act as a 'data processor' if you provide us with access to personal data controlled by you in order to perform our Services (for example, if we need access to your customer database for a project). In such cases, we will only process the data according to your instructions and our contractual agreement.

docContent.title: 5. International Data Transfers
content: Our business is global, which means your personal data may be transferred to, stored, and processed in countries other than your own, including the United States, where our company is registered. These countries may have data protection laws that are different from the laws of your country.

When we transfer personal data internationally, we take steps to ensure it is protected. For transfers of data from regions such as the European Economic Area (EEA), UK, or Switzerland, we rely on appropriate safeguards, such as the Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) approved by the European Commission, to ensure that your data is treated securely and in accordance with this Privacy Policy.

docContent.title: 6. Data Security & Retention
content: We apply commercially reasonable administrative, technical, and physical safeguards (HTTPS, access controls, least-privilege practices, vendor reviews). No method is 100% secure.
We keep personal data only as long as necessary for the purposes above and to meet legal/record-keeping duties. When retention ends, we delete or de-identify data.
list: Contact/leads: typically 12‚Äì24 months after last interaction.
Project and billing records: typically 7 years for legal and tax purposes.
Security logs: 90‚Äì365 days unless needed longer.

docContent.title: 7. Your Rights
list: Access, correct, delete, object/restrict, and port your data.
Withdraw consent (where processing relies on consent).
File a complaint with your local supervisory authority.
content: To exercise your rights, please email contact@rekhia.com. We may need to verify your identity before processing your request. Please note that these rights are not absolute and may be subject to our own legal obligations (for example, we cannot delete billing data that we are required to keep for tax purposes).

docContent.title: 8. Children‚Äôs Privacy & Third-Party Links
content: Our Site and Services are not directed to children under 16 (or the applicable age of consent). We do not knowingly collect data from children; if you believe a child has provided data, contact us to remove it.
The Site may link to third-party websites or services; their privacy practices are their own‚Äîplease review their policies.

docContent.title: 9. Changes & Contact
content: We may update this Policy from time to time. The 'Last updated' date will reflect the current version; material changes may be highlighted on the Site.

articles.title: About Us
articles.subtitle: Effective Date
articles.introduction: Rekhia is a UX & Software Studio that partners with ambitious businesses to build reliable, elegant, and scalable digital platforms. We operate under Busdigital LLC, a Limited Liability Company registered in New Mexico, USA. We exist to close the gap between a powerful business vision and the technology required to bring it to life.

docContent.title: 1. Our Philosophy: Beyond the Code
content: We believe that great technology should feel effortless. Many businesses are held back by digital experiences that are clunky, unreliable, or difficult to scale. Rekhia was founded on a simple principle: to create clean, high-performance digital products that are a pleasure to use and easy to manage. We combine strategic design with robust engineering to build platforms that don't just work, but empower your business to grow.

docContent.title: 2. Who We Serve
content: We work best with startups, SaaS companies, and established businesses that are ready to invest in a high-quality digital foundation. Our ideal partners are forward-thinking leaders who understand that a superior user experience is a critical competitive advantage.

docContent.title: 3. Our Core Services
list: UX/UI Design ‚Äì From in-depth research to pixel-perfect interfaces that drive user action.
Web & App Development ‚Äì Building high-performance, responsive, and secure platforms.
E-commerce Solutions ‚Äì Crafting seamless online retail experiences, from storefront to checkout.
Support Plans ‚Äì Providing dedicated ongoing care, maintenance, and optimization.

docContent.title: 4. Our Process: From Idea to Impact
list: Discovery ‚Äì We don't just ask what you want; we uncover what your business needs to succeed.
Design ‚Äì We visualize the user journey with clarity, creating intuitive and consistent experiences.
Development ‚Äì We build with modern, scalable frameworks and a fanaticism for clean code.
Delivery & Support ‚Äì We launch your product and provide the ongoing support needed for continuous improvement.

docContent.title: 5. Our Values in Action
list: Precision ‚Äì Every detail impacts user trust. We are meticulous in our work to ensure a flawless final product that reflects the quality of your brand.
Clarity ‚Äì Ambiguity creates risk. We prioritize clear communication, transparent processes, and intuitive design so you always know where we stand.
Scalability ‚Äì Your success is our goal. We build flexible systems that can grow from 100 users to 100,000 without requiring a complete rebuild.
